entries.meaning: Taking place before, or in preparation for, a sporting event.
A social gathering of several friends who get together to drink before going out to a party or a sports game, in order to get a "buzz" before going out for the night.
A television show preceding a sports game wherein commentators discuss that game.
examples: At the first Super Bowl, the pregame featured the marching bands from the University of Arizona and Grambling University.

entries.meaning: (figurative) A period of time before an important event.

verbs.description: pregame (third-person singular simple present pregames, present participle pregaming, simple past and past participle pregamed)

entries.meaning: (slang, intransitive) To consume alcohol prior to an event.
